other_tests.findings: Reticular pseudodrusen were observed with deposits rich in vitronectin, photoreceptor-associated proteins, and immune cells. Cellular analysis revealed photoreceptor disruption and localized gliosis, along with anomalies in the RPE.
RPD appeared as white triangular lesions projecting into the subretinal space, confirmed by histologic sections.
No TUNEL labeling of photoreceptor nuclei was noted in areas containing RPD.
GFAP expression increased in MÃ¼ller cells in regions adjacent to RPD, indicating localized stress.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No exacerbation of gliosis in larger RPD compared with smaller RPD was noted.

other_tests.findings: RPD were unlabeled by Oil Red O, suggesting a distinct lipid composition compared to conventional drusen.
